channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3942] The most WTF pic I've seen today (PIC)
item.description: Ever seen a picture where you can't really tell if it's NSFW or not? I don't think this is, but my brain's too busy 'splodin' to figure it out.

item.title: [+2956] Amazing: 10-Foot 'Photographs' Drawn With Ballpoint Pens
item.description: They may look like pin-sharp photographs - but these amazing pictures are actually drawings created with the humble ballpoint pen. The stunning pictures, measuring up to 10ft high, were drawn by a rising star of the art world, Juan Francisco Casas.

item.title: [+2553] Alice In Wonderland Trailer Released
item.description: Tim Burton's twisted take on the classic children's story Alice in Wonderland doesn't hit theaters until next year, but the trailer has just been released.

item.title: [+2062] Cruisin' (WTF?)
[+1937] Obama's Drug Czar Lies About Medical Marijuana
item.description: "Marijuana is dangerous and has no medicinal benefit," Drug Czar Gil Kerlikowske said in downtown Fresno while discussing a multiagency effort to eradicate marijuana in eastern Fresno County, even though his boss, President Obama, campaigned on a pledge to stop bullying medical marijuana in California.

item.title: [+1569] Man, 74, Shoots Carjacker, 18
item.description: HOUSTON -- A 74-year-old man shoots an 18-year-old who tried to carjack him outside his home. The punk brought a knife to a gun fight, quite literally.

item.title: [+1527] Top 15 Web Hoaxes of All Time
item.description: For hundreds of years, humans have been playing elaborate tricks on each other, but the advent of social tools means that hoaxes are much more easily spread.

item.title: [+1494] Pentagon furious over call for execution of captured soldier
item.description: According to NBC’s top Pentagon correspondent, the Department of Defense is furious with Fox News analyst Ralph Peters, who said on July 19 that the Taliban should murder 23-year-old Private First Class Bowe Bergdahl, captured after he strayed from his post, to save the Army “legal hassles and legal bills.” -=W/ VIDEO=-

item.title: [+1285] Bill Maher: New Rule: Not Everything in America Has to Make
item.description: When did the profit motive become the only reason to do anything? When did that become the new patriotism? Ask not what you could do for your country, ask what's in it for Blue Cross/Blue Shield.

item.title: [+1268] People Emit Visible Light (PIC)
item.description: Japanese researchers have shown that the body emits visible light, 1,000 times less intense than the levels to which our naked eyes are sensitive.

item.title: [+1256] Linux Users Should Say: Goodbye Apple
item.description: For the longest time, I could use gtkpod to seamlessly access my iPods from my Ubuntu desktop. It initially took some reverse-engineering effort to understand the iPod's data format to be able to access it from non-iTunes software, but it was possible. All of a sudden, Apple is trying everything they can to prohibit interoperability.

item.title: [+1018] Video: How to Build a PC - Every Step Explained
item.description: We shot this video demonstration to show people how to build a killer PC, one step at a time. It's a great reference for beginners and experts alike.

item.title: [+987] John Barry, inventor of WD-40, dies. Rust in Peace
item.description: John S. Barry, an executive who masterminded the spread of WD-40, the petroleum-based lubricant and protectant created for the space program, into millions of American households, died on July 3 in the La Jolla neighborhood of San Diego. He was 84.

item.title: [+954] The Comic-con Cosplay '09, Good, Bad, and Bizarre [PICS]
item.description: Every year the comic-con cosplay gives comic-con its amazing pageantry. This years batch of sexy and crazy doesn't disappoint.

item.title: [+829] Bill Gates: My 1979 Memories
item.description: Our Gizmodo '79 celebration may have ended last week, but there's room for a final post, written by famed retiree and mosquito wrangler Bill Gates. It's no joke: Gates read the series then sent this in: I read those 1979 stories all last week, and it put me in a nostalgic mood, so wanted to offer my own memory to add to the collection.

item.title: [+819] Keith Eloi jumps out of the Pool BACKWARDS
item.description: Take That B.J. Penn! After a pool workout Redskins rookie WR Keith Eloi Jumps out of the pool backwards.

item.title: [+761] Wal-Mart beats Best Buy with $298 laptop
item.description: Wal-Mart undercuts Best Buy by $1 by offering a $298 Compaq Presario laptop. "For the first time, a 3GB memory laptop from a well-known brand has ventured below $300," Wal-Mart said in a statement Thursday.

item.title: [+738] Facebook Relents, Lets You Change Your Username
item.description: Last month, Facebook finally announced that they would allow users to pick out custom usernames for use in vanity URLs that read www.facebook.com/username. At the time, users were advised to "choose wisely" because the username they selected would be stuck with them for life. That didn't stop some Facebook users from picking out names ....

item.title: [+705] Dude, how did you get up there?
item.description: Oreamnos americanus. Glacier National Park, Montana, U.S. of A.

item.title: [+693] Ubuntu to make Linux application installation idiot proof
item.description: Installing applications on Linux isn't really that hard, but it is different from how it's handled on both Windows and Macs. Now, Ubuntu is working on a newbie-proof way for users to install Linux programs.
